tool.name: snippy
tool.command:
#if $ref.is_of_type("fasta") cp "$ref" "foo.fna" && #end if #if $ref.is_of_type("genbank") cp "$ref" "foo.gbk" && #end if snippy --outdir "out" --cpus "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}" #if $ref.is_of_type("fasta") --ref "foo.fna" #end if #if $ref.is_of_type("genbank") --ref "foo.gbk" #end if $adv.cleanup --mapqual $adv.mapqual --mincov $adv.mincov --minfrac $adv.minfrac #if $adv.rgid --rgid $advanced.rgid #end if #if $adv.bwaopt --bwaopt "$advanced.bwaopt" #end if
#if str( $fastq_input.fastq_input_selector ) == "paired" --pe1 "$fastq_input.fastq_input1" --pe2 "$fastq_input.fastq_input2" #end if #if str( $fastq_input.fastq_input_selector ) == "paired_collection" --pe1 "$fastq_input.fastq_input1.forward" --pe2 "$fastq_input.fastq_input1.reverse" #end if #if str( $fastq_input.fastq_input_selector ) == "single" --se "$fastq_input.fastq_input1" #end if #if str( $fastq_input.fastq_input_selector ) == "paired_iv" --peil "$fastq_input.fastq_input1" #end if
&&
gunzip out/snps.depth.gz
&&
tar -czf out.tgz out
&&
tail out/snps.log

param.name: ref
param.label: Reference File (either in fasta or genbank format)
param.help: Fasta or Genbank file to use as the reference

param.name: fastq_input_selector
param.label: Single or Paired-end reads
param.help: Select between paired and single end data

param.name: fastq_input1
param.label: Select a paired collection
param.help: See help section for an explanation of dataset collections

param.name: cleanup
param.label: Cleanup the non-snp output files
param.help: Remove all non-SNP files: BAMs, indices etc

param.name: mincov
param.label: Minimum coverage
param.help: Minimum coverage to call a snp

param.name: rgid
param.label: Bam header @RG ID
param.help: Use this @RG ID: in the BAM header

param.name: bwaopt
param.label: Extra BWA MEM options
param.help: Extra BWA MEM options, eg. -x pacbio

tool.help:
**Snippy 3.1**
Snippy finds SNPs between a haploid reference genome and your NGS sequence reads. It will find both substitutions (snps) and insertions/deletions (indels).
**Author** Torsten Seemann <torsten.seemann@gmail.com>
**Inputs**
* NGS Reads in fastq format (single or paired end) * Reference file in either fasta or genbank format
If the reference file is supplied in genbank format, snpeff will be called to determine the effect of any snps found.
**Advanced options**
- mapping quality - Integer - Minimum mapping quality to allow (default '60')
- minimum coverage - Integer - Minimum coverage of variant site (default '10')
- minimum fraction - Float - Minumum proportion for variant evidence (default '0.9')
- cleanup - Remove all non-SNP files: BAMs, indices etc (default OFF)
- rgid - String - Use this @RG ID: in the BAM header (default '')
- bwaopt - Extra BWA MEM options, eg. -x pacbio (default '')
**Further information**
For a much more in depth description of snippy and how it works, see https://github.com/tseemann/snippy
